result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott A. Casey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Eau Claire County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

3 days of jail credit if revoked from Probation

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.
AODA and follow through with recommendations. AODA to be completed within 6 months of today.

Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

timeConds.notes:
Huber or electronic monitoring approved if allowed by the jail.
All stayed pending further order of the court.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott A. Casey

records.addlTxt: The Repeater Enhancer on Count 1 was removed.

9:11 AM Defendant Scott A. Casey in court.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Scott A. Casey.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. There is an agreement. 

Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 1: Possession of Methamphetamine as a Party to a Crime WITHOUT the repeater. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders: 3 years Probation sentence withheld with conditions.
Conditions of Probation:
180 days jail, with Huber or Electronic Monitoring if jail determines him eligible, all stayed pending further order of the court.
AODA and follow through with recommendations. AODA to be completed within 6 months from today.
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
court costs and surcharges

Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in. 

3 days of jail credit if revoked from Probation.
Status conference on June 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 2:59 PM.
Defendant Scott A. Casey in court with Attorney Roger M Hillestad. Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas.  Court grants 20 days to file motions.
Attorney Hillestad requests a STC in one month.
STC: 6/24/22 at 9:30 AM.

Case called at 9:21 AM.
Defendant Scott A. Casey not in court.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Scott A. Casey.  Attorney Trenton Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Hillestad has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance and requests a short adjournment.
State notes previous failures to appear but does not object to an adjournment.]
ARGN: 5/12/22 at 3:00 PM.
Counts same as the criminal complaint as they relate to the defendant.

(Case called at 10:57 AM) Prosecuting attorney DA Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Scott A. Casey in court.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Scott A. Casey. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
Arraignment to be scheduled with Branch 2 Judicial Assistant.

10:42 AM case called.  Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Scott A. Casey not in court and does not appear via Zoom, Attorney Roger M Hillestad not in court.
Hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
